ygData.subject: Re: Bug in Reaction::operator==
ygData.msgSnippet: Why do you say these are not the same reaction? One is written in the reverse direction, but both are reversible. This is not a bug in my opinion, but a

Why do you say these are not the same reaction? One is written in the
rever=
se direction, but both are reversible. This is not a "bug" in my
opinion, b=
ut a "feature"...

Dave


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "avmokhov" <avmok=
hov@...> wrote:
>
> Hello,
> When parsing the chemical mechanism, Cantera w=
rongly marks these 
> reactions as duplicate:
> CH2OH+CH3O<=3D>CH2O+CH3OH
>=
 CH2O+CH3OH=3DCH2OH+CH2OH
> Quick look in the source shows that the operato=
r
Reaction=A1=CBoperator=3D=3D is 
> implemented without taking into accoun=
t the possibility that the 
> reaction equation can contain the same substa=
nces (as the second 
> reaction in the example). Unfortunately, it seems fo=
r me that fixing 
> this bug is only possible by completely rewriting React=
ion=A1=CBoperator=3D=3D.
> 
> Best regards, Anatoli
